thread.title_full: Residence Inn West Palm Beach Downtown/CityPlace Area Partners With Animal Rescue League To Help Save Furry Friends

title: Residence Inn West Palm Beach Downtown/CityPlace Area Partners With Animal Rescue League To Help Save Furry Friends
text: Residence Inn West Palm Beach Downtown/CityPlace Area Partners With Animal Rescue League To Help Save Furry Friends By PR Newswire | 08/13/15 - 09:12 AM EDT Reprint WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. , Aug. 13, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Animal lovers will rejoice as Residence Inn West Palm Beach Downtown/CityPlace Area announces a partnership with a Palm Beach -based humane society to assist with the care and sheltering of homeless and unwanted animals. The pet-friendly hotel in Downtown West Palm Beach has teamed up with Peggy Adams Animal Rescue League and will donate $10 per room night booked through Dec. 19, 2015 . Rates begin at just $114 per night at the extended-stay hotel. Peggy Adams Animal Rescue League was founded in 1924 with the vision to provide shelter to lost, homeless and unwanted animals; spay, neuter and offer other medical services for companion animals; and care, protect and find quality homes for homeless and neglected companion animals. The nonprofit agency is an advocate for animal welfare in the West Palm Beach area and encourages community involvement and education to further the bond between people and animals. Travelers and their four-legged friends are always welcome at Residence Inn and can start each day with a complimentary hot breakfast buffet in the lobby before exploring the city. Or, guests may choose to cook breakfast in the full-sized kitchen in their suite after utilizing the hotel's free grocery service. 1 of 2
